metadata.scenario: Customer support interaction about a billing issue

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hi, I'm calling about a billing issue. I think I was overcharged this month.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Hello! I can certainly help with that. Could you please provide your account number so I can look into this for you?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Sure, it's 1234567890. I looked at the bill and I don't understand why I was charged for extra data usage. I barely used any this month!

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Thank you. Let me access your account information... Okay, I see the charges. It looks like there were some instances of data overage. Can you confirm what device used the data?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: I only use my phone for data. The usage shown seems way too high for what I normally do, which is mostly texting and a little bit of browsing. This is so frustrating!

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: I understand your frustration. Let me check the logs to see what happened. One moment... Okay, I see some of it. Is it possible a background app may have been using data without your knowledge?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Well, maybe. But isn't there a way to tell *which* app was the culprit? Shouldn't your systems be able to pinpoint that for me?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Unfortunately, due to privacy restrictions, our system doesn't show individual app usage. I can see the total amount of data used, but not the specific apps that consumed it. I can, however, offer you a one-time credit to compensate for the unexpected charges.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, a credit would be great. How much are we talking about, and how soon will it appear on my bill?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: I've applied a credit of $25 to your account. This should reflect on your next billing statement, and it will be effective within 3-5 business days. Is there anything else I can assist you with today?
